attributes.action: demand the National Blood Service change its policy of denying homosexual male donors
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The National Blood Service’s website questionnaire asks: "Are you a man who has had sex with another man (even if you used a condom)?" Click YES & it says "Thank you for your time but it seems you are not able to give blood"
This question is part of the screening procedure of the nationwide blood donation scheme designed to locate interested donors & discourage carriers of Hepatitis/HIV. 
This is institutional homophobia that trivialises and over simplifies sexual identity & dignity. The National Blood Service only alludes to the subject of ‘homosexuality’ yet it discriminates.
There are thousands of willing gay men with clean blood who currently cannot donate, are made to feel inferior and whose friends & family members choose not to donate in protest.
In place of outdated and intrusive questions and assumptions this essential service needs a Government monitored scientifically reliable blood-screening process that does not screen out homosexuals in the name of safety for ‘everyone else’.
